display_name: Highest education level completed by the participant
Morning Survey: Self report sleep duration
description: About how many hours of restful sleep do you feel you got last night?

Finally, we would like you to rate how sleepy you feel right now, just as you did last night before sleep. The scale ranges from 1 to 7, with 7 being the most sleepy. Please read the entire scale below and then check the level that best describes your current state of sleepiness.
How well did you sleep last night? (Please check one)

Position the tape slightly above the eyebrows in a horizontal plane to the back of the head, measuring the maximum circumference. Make sure not to include large amounts of hair and hair accessories under the tape. Pull tape slightly to compress hair and record measurement to the nearest 0.5 cm
Height (without shoes) to the nearest cm. on mechanical beam scale with participant facing outward and measuring bar perpendicular to floor
Measure at largest circumference over the buttocks with participant standing erect with arms at side
Measure at largest circumference over the buttocks with participant standing erect with arms at side
With participant sitting or standing erect, measure below “Adam’s Apple” at the smallest circumference of neck with tape perpendicular to the long axis of the neck
With participant sitting or standing erect, measure below “Adam’s Apple” at the smallest circumference of neck with tape perpendicular to the long axis of the neck

This question refers to how sleepy or alert you feel at a particular time. We would like you to read the scale below and then rate how sleepy you feel right now. The scale ranges from 1 to 7, with 7 being the most sleepy. Please read the entire scale, and then check the level that best describes your current state of  sleepiness.

With participant standing erect with arms at side and abdomen relaxed, measure at the smallest circumference near the navel and above the pelvis at the natural waistline. If no obvious waist, measure at the navel

With participant standing erect with arms at side and abdomen relaxed, measure at the smallest circumference near the navel and above the pelvis at the natural waistline. If no obvious waist, measure at the navel
Record weight to the nearest 0.5 kg on mechanical beam scale.

display_name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale: Chance of dozing while in a car, while stopped for a few minutes in the traffic
description:
Item from the Epworth Sleepiness Scale [Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1798888)

[Search for all ESS variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/wsc/variables?search=epworth)
Calculated - Total score based on an 8-item questionnaires ranking likelihood of dozing off Johns MW 1991 (PubMed ID: 1798888). Scale 0-3 for individual items; 0 to 24 for overall score.
calculation: ess_total = ess_1sitread + ess_2watchingtv + ess_3sitinactive + ess_4passenger + ess_5lyingdown + ess_6sittalk + ess_7afterlunch + ess_8stoppedcar

display_name: Alcohol consumption - number of beverages per week
calculation: sum(of beer_week, hard_week, wine_week), 0 if nondrinker="Y"

display_name: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES): Indicator for insomnia symptoms
description: Calculated: If any of the four insomnia symptoms (i.e. difficulty falling asleep, difficulty falling back to sleep, waking up frequently, waking up too early) have a frequency of more than 5-15 time a month, then it’s a 1: yes.
calculation: 1=Yes if Y any of the following were a 3 or 4 (ps_diff, ps_backsleep, ps_wakerepeat, ps_tooearly), 0=all 4 variables were 0, 1, or 2

display_name: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES): Count of frequent insomnia symptoms
description: Calculated: Count the number of insomnia symptoms (i.e. difficulty falling asleep, difficulty falling back to sleep, waking up frequently, waking up too early) with a frequency of more than 5-15 time a month.
calculation: Count of the number of the following at a 3 or 4 (ps_diff, ps_backsleep, ps_wakerepeat, ps_tooearly), 0=all 4 variables were 0, 1, or 2

display_name: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES): Total days per month having any insomnia symptoms
description: Calculated: Sum of responses to insomnia symptoms (i.e. difficulty falling asleep, difficulty falling back to sleep, waking up frequently, waking up too early) where 0=0, 1=1, 2=3, 3=10, 4=25
calculation: Sum of responses to (ps_diff, ps_backsleep, ps_wakerepeat, ps_tooearly) where 0=0, 1=1, 2=3, 3=10, 4=25
